WRITING.TITLE: You swap lives with your SO. What do they see in you that someone else can't offer?

WRITING.TEXT: If a primary client, customer, or competitor started treating you like complete shit, and you always wanted to find a way to get "even" with them to teach them a lesson. Then you find some leverage, what sort of way do you test the air to reinforce the ego swaps? Like, it could be a customer that thinks they can make your life miserable and there's nothing you can do about it. Now that you can do something about it, how do you test the air to see if they understand you can now leverage them? It could be something as simple as "Hey, can you tie my shoe for me?"
Like, the first thing you'd assign them to make them feel like you're the one in power now. Like, to sort of test the waters to see if they can handle your job.

WRITING.TITLE: The CEO swaps your job with your boss's job. What's the first thing you do to get "even"?

WRITING.TEXT: D'oh!

Starting off with a misunderstanding or setting a bad first impression. e.g. like in the parking lot, coming late, or not dressing in a professional manner. Unable to explain your work history in an optimistic manner, without making yourself look bad. Unable to elaborate when questioned on your resume and keep a straight story. Saying you're a lazy kind of person, and/or that you procrastinate with anything. Giving them a complicated answer to a simple question that should have a simple answer. Saying you already have your dream job and don't really need them, just but looking for slightly better. (thought this was a good idea in the past to show you're not desperate, but then if you don't need them, and then they don't need you) Resorting to vulgar speech, and/or getting physical. Not acting professional. And last, but not least, creeping them out, like by starring at their privates.
As a dude, it's like 90%, and 5 minutes into flirting.

Kept losing eye contact to look at the interviewer's boobs. I had no interest in her whatsoever, but couldn't control my eyes as I was inexperienced with the interview process then, and I was unprepared to expect it feeling somewhat like a date. I'm not used to looking straight into a smoking hot women's eyes when they're dressing to kill, returning eye contact, and so interested in hearing about me, much in the same way finding a job is like finding a soulmate. I've also ran into clients on the Ops side where it was obvious we liked each other's personalities and voices. Upon ending off, I found myself restraining myself from saying "love you" as the conversation felt a lot like speaking with a girlfriend that I've known for a while. At an older job, I always had a hard time processing what to think of my boss when he would speak to one of our vendors like she was his wife. Now I can finally relate to that.

[The XX - Intro](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jkhpZoPOfZI t=16s)

Nothing beats mixes in the car in my experience, especially for 100+ mile drives back and forth between cities. [Adam Sandler - Piece Of Shit Car](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Fw0OvKFKhw) really feels like a completely different song in the car, and can be quite amusing. [Agnes Obel - Fuel To Fire (Dexcell Remix)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DzNwsCDClgc) is a random song I found to be great in the car. Some more handpicked stuff I'd put would be [Justin Timberlake - Can't Stop the Feeling!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ru0K8uYEZWw) (great at parties too). I'm a big Linkin Park fan, and driving I was surprised to find that I like [The Catalyst](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=51iquRYKPbs) more than [Numb](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kXYiU_JCYtU) while driving. Gotta have some classics like [Beach Boys - Wouldn't It Be Nice](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nZBKFoeDKJo) and [Lynyrd Skynyrd - Sweet Home Alabama](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ye5BuYf8q4o). [The XX - Intro](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_VPKfacgXao) for some reason I associated it with Muhammad Ali, probably from [this video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jkhpZoPOfZI). Frank Sinatra - New York, New York. [Susanne Vega - Tom's Diner](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YjCsnI-3i6A) and some metal songs like [Enter Sandman Metallica](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CD-E-LDc384).
But if I had to pick actual albums, I prefer Linkin Park's "Hybrid Theory" album. I've tried other albums from them such as Meteora, but doesn't work as well. Evanescence puts out some really good albums too, such as Fallen. Meticalla's Garage Inc. On rainy days, I can listen to Enya's Watermark album.
But on most days, honestly, I just pull up Pandora and jump back and forth between stations like Linkin Park radio, Smooth Jazz, and Easy Listening radio.

Everyone is desirable to someone out there, but if you're attracting the wrong crowd, it's important to be comfortable in one's own skin. Identify and celebrate your strengths, create a future-self, something you want to strive to become, a self you can accept, then strive to help that future-inner-self materialize because that's the direction you want to head in life. Once you've done that, there should be a greater sense of synchronization between one's inside and outside. Even if you fail to do this, if you meet people with similar insides which you also admire their outsides, then you can work out long-term even without achieving this synchronization. Sometimes finding people which aren't in sync with themselves either is enough compatibility to work out. You'll know when you've hit any sort of milestones in this area. And when you've done that, you'll start attracting the right sort of crowds because you're in sync with yourself and it's not a battle of present vs future. But until then, realize there's people out there which you meet which are meant as a lesson, short-term relationships, and there's marriage material. Things like nurturing your health is a great way to move in the right direction to open up opportunities. Know there's also people out there which don't need any sort of relationship whatsoever and don't need people to make them feel better. Accepting oneself, and playing one's hand as best as one can is about the best one can do. Again, everyone is desirable to someone out there. But desiring them back is not always the case. Communication is another issue. Probably half the people you meet actually want to bang, and you'd have no idea that is the case without becoming a better flirt. Sorry for the monstrous paragraph, but hopefully there's something helpful in there.

In my experience, it's always been health and/or diet related. Get out there and start running as far as you can, cool down, drink some water, eat something healthy, then do some more running. Cool down to a nice shower, and lay back on your couch in front of the tv and put-on something sports or fitness related, and force yourself to watch it, even the commercials. Eat some nuts or something and prepare for yourself a snack as you watch it. Got a craving for something junky? Remind yourself you want to work on push-ups. Do as many as you can comfortably, cool off for a minute or two, then work on some more and do some sets. Get some more water, then start focusing on some stretching. Got a sudden urge to jump on the computer? How urgent is it, is it just to mess around? Ask yourself what are you procrastinating from. And then start working on some situps. Run a bit more while you try to figure out what is it that you got to do better. Get back, work on some more food, and devour. You'll feel like a million bucks and be able to finally focus on whatever it is you're procrastinating from. In my experience, it's usually communication or understanding related why I'd push something off due to an unknown factor. Do your research and make it your business to become a good learner. It's not about being able to finish first, it's about being able to recognize when you're falling short and goofing off and adjusting yourself with proper priorities, inching your way through when it's the hardest. Like getting in sync with the rest of the world, whether that's getting on a better schedule, cleaning your room, organizing your desk, taking out the trash, doing your laundry, or whatever the heck is cluttering up your life. Start fresh and the world is yours for the taking.
